repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: In MANPAGER mode, pressing q after jumping to a different tag does not quit, instead E444 is thrown (#25943)

Solution: 
1. Change `b:pager` into `g:pager`, a global
2. Functions in man.lua now will not change the status of `g:pager` if it has already been set.

comment_data.body: If `g:pager` is a global it doesn't need to be set in `set_options`, so you can remove the argument from `set_options` and just change this to `set_options()`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -729,6 +733,8 @@ function M.open_page(count, smods, args)
 
   if not ok then
     error(ret)
+  elseif vim.fn.exists('g:pager') == 1 then
+    set_options(vim.g.pager)

@@ -475,7 +475,11 @@ local function put_page(page)
   vim.cmd([[silent! keeppatterns keepjumps %s/\s\{199,}/\=repeat(' ', 10)/g]])
   vim.cmd('1') -- Move cursor to first line
   highlight_man_page()
-  set_options(false)
+  if vim.fn.exists('g:pager') == 1 then
+    set_options(vim.g.pager)
+  else
+    set_options(false)
+  end

@@ -419,7 +419,7 @@ local function set_options(pager)
   vim.bo.modified = false
   vim.bo.readonly = true
   vim.bo.modifiable = false
-  vim.b.pager = pager
+  vim.g.pager = pager

comment_data.body:
GitHub does not let me comment on unchanged lines, but also change `set_options(true)` on line 669 to

```lua
vim.g.pager = true
set_options()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -729,6 +733,8 @@ function M.open_page(count, smods, args)
 
   if not ok then
     error(ret)
+  elseif vim.fn.exists('g:pager') == 1 then
+    set_options(vim.g.pager)

comment_data.body: That does seem like a more clean solution, but `g:pager` now does not exist in normal Man buffers. I don't know whether this is an ok behavior. Previously it is set to false.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -729,6 +733,8 @@ function M.open_page(count, smods, args)
 
   if not ok then
     error(ret)
+  elseif vim.fn.exists('g:pager') == 1 then
+    set_options(vim.g.pager)

comment_data.body: It's fine if `g:pager` doesn't exist in normal Man buffers. It only needs to be set when Nvim was started as MANPAGER.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -729,6 +733,8 @@ function M.open_page(count, smods, args)
 
   if not ok then
     error(ret)
+  elseif vim.fn.exists('g:pager') == 1 then
+    set_options(vim.g.pager)

@@ -729,6 +728,8 @@ function M.open_page(count, smods, args)
 
   if not ok then
     error(ret)
+  elseif vim.fn.exists('g:pager') == 1 then
+    set_options(vim.g.pager)

comment_data.body: And change the line below from `set_options(false)` to `set_options()`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -729,6 +728,8 @@ function M.open_page(count, smods, args)
 
   if not ok then
     error(ret)
+  elseif vim.fn.exists('g:pager') == 1 then
+    set_options(vim.g.pager)

@@ -729,6 +728,8 @@ function M.open_page(count, smods, args)
 
   if not ok then
     error(ret)
+  elseif vim.fn.exists('g:pager') == 1 then
+    set_options(vim.g.pager)

comment_data.body: this test is nearly a duplicate of the above. can you just add `+tag ls` to the above test , I don't think we need a new, separate test.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -197,6 +197,19 @@ describe(':Man', function()
     matches('quit works!!', fn.system(args, { 'manpage contents' }))
   end)
 
+  it('q quits in "$MANPAGER mode" after jumping to a different tag (:Man!) #25943', function()
